title: 5 updates on Pfizer, Moderna and J&J COVID-19 vaccine efficacy
author: Katie Adams
description: Here are findings from five studies on COVID-19 vaccines that have been released in the past three weeks.
cleaned_text: Here are findings from five studies on COVID-19 vaccines that have been released in the past three weeks. - Pfizer [released](https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/pharmacy/pfizer-says-covid-19-vaccine-is-100-effective-in-teens-ages-12-15.html)data Nov. 22 showing its COVID-19 vaccine was 100 percent effective at preventing disease among recipients ages 12-15, measured from seven days to four months after they received their second shot. - A study published Dec. 1 in The New England Journal of Medicine [showed](https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/pharmacy/moderna-s-covid-19-vaccine-works-slightly-better-than-pfizer-s-study-says.html)that Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine was slightly more effective than Pfizer's at preventing disease and subsequent negative outcomes among U.S. veterans. - A study published Dec. 2 in The Lancet [showed](https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/pharmacy/most-effective-covid-19-boosters-are-mrna-vaccines-study-shows.html)that the COVID-19 vaccines made by Pfizer and Moderna are most effective at boosting antibody levels among fully vaccinated adults. - A small study published Dec. 5 in the preprint server MedRxiv [showed](https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/pharmacy/j-j-booster-effective-for-pfizer-vaccine-recipients-study-shows.html)that people who received two doses of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine might get the same increase in immunity from a Johnson & Johnson booster dose as one from Pfizer. - Pfizer [said](https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/pharmacy/pfizer-says-its-booster-provides-strong-protection-against-omicron.html)Dec. 8 its COVID-19 booster provided significant protection against the omicron variant during a laboratory study.
